programs.show_description: Learn programming principles without a computer! Animated characters provide fun and lucid explanations of five core processes: analysis, combination, generalisation, abstraction and simulation.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Japan's exciting music scene with pop, rock, traditional, live performances, artist interviews, all the latest news, video releases and more!
Tohoku: This animation series follows Japanese dog Charo as he meets and is helped by many mythical creatures of northern Japan in the search for eight star talismans.
Hyper-modern Japanese kitchens are compact and comfortable spaces for cooking and eating - we look at the history and evolution of this space at the heart of every Japanese home.
Discover the lesser-known charms and customs of regions through the eyes of cats in this unique trip around Japan filmed by wildlife photographer Iwago Mitsuaki!
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
A unique walking-eye view of cities around the globe! Chat to the locals and enjoy encounters that only strolling the streets can bring.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
NHK World-Japan presents a wide range of programmes from news, current affairs, and documentaries focusing on Japan and Asia.
Miyama is famous for its roof-thatching tradition - the town of Hanase continues to serve its local speciality, foraged wild food cuisine.
This time: relaying messages. Dong Quoc Dung was transferred to a Japanese headquarters in 2018; he is expected to return one day and be a hub for HQ. He learns how to take messages accurately.

Anyone can come in and make clothes at Yoshimura Mayu's atelier - the materials are discards from industry and major brands, and working together leads to great ideas they couldn't come up with alone.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
This flagship documentary series offers must-see episodes on politics, the economy, social trends, science and the environment in Japan and beyond.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Chiyonofuji: the late Yokozuna Chiyonofuji beat shoulder injuries and achieved success due to rigorous training - we look back on his technique, dedication to family and strength through adversity.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
A ride through Hokkaido in early summer. We meet an artisan teaching handicrafts of the indigenous Ainu to the next generation, and a legendary trainer of an unusual horse race.

Puppet action show for children. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.

A spotlight on our diverse international community as we report on issues, speak to those involved, and get a fresh look at what it's like to live in Japan.
Japanese chum salmon migrate over 20,000 kilometres in their return journey across the North Pacific - global warming has caused an alarming decline in returning salmon and requires urgent action.
NHK World-Japan presents a variety of short programmes focusing on Japan and Asia.
People from around the globe who put down roots in Japan offer a glimpse into their lives and the hardships that they face in Japanese society.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
The Murakami Kaizoku were seafarers and fighters in the Seto Inland Sea - we explore their history and legacy with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: Nii Oshima Island.
Japan has a long history of natural disasters - 'Bosai' explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science.
The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture - this episode looks at words related to hair. Explore the unique culture behind them.
#10 How much is this hairdryer? / To ask the price of something in front of you, say 'kono', meaning 'this', followed by the item's name and 'wa ikura desu ka?'.
What preparations are needed to protect children in the event of a disaster? This episode considers not only their physical safety, but also their mental wellbeing during stressful evacuations.
NHK World-Japan presents a variety of short programmes focusing on Japan and Asia.

This programme visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

This upbeat programme combines business and economic news with in-depth feature stories that give you a closer look at the latest trends within Japan and around the world.

A local supermarket specialising in seafood closes after nearly 50 years - to keep its legacy alive, the founder teams up with a supermarket chain. Can it survive amidst fierce competition?
Chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto, and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery at the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama.
